title: Entertainment Live: Peter Jackson 'snubs' Doctor Who; Len Goodman defends Strictly from 'fix' claims - BBC News
summary: reactions to the bbc 's sound of 2016 long list .
len goodman defends strictly over fix claims .

documents.title: peter jackson 'to direct ' doctor who ?
text: maybe not , but the director has posted a funny skit on his facebook page , featuring him and his daughter katie and peter capaldi .
katie : `` hey dad , steven moffat is trying to email you '' .
peter : ( polishing his oscars ) `` he 's always trying to email me .
i reply to the ones i can understand but some of them are incoherent , like his scripts . ''
go on , have a look .

documents.title: ttfn
text: that 's it for today , folks .
thanks for joining us , and we leave you with this skit from oscar-winning director , peter jackson .
see you tomorrow !

documents.title: izzy bizu on her sound of 2016 nomination
text: r & b star izzy bizu celebrated her nomination for the bbc music sound of 2016 by dropping in to chat with 1 xtra dj trevor nelson .
she discussed her eclectic influences , her dungarees and how she grew up in the middle east .
listen to the interview above - and catch up with the singer 's latest single , white tiger , below .
author: Mark Savage
Music reporter

documents.title: jennifer lawrence on david o russell
text: a-lister jennifer lawrence has said she will continue to make movies with david o russell until the day the director dies .

speaking at a q & a after the premiere of the pair 's latest collaboration , joy , jennifer replied to a question about being asked to star in the film : `` if it 's david , my only questions are 'when ? '
and 'where ? ' ''
the oscar-winner plays inventor joy mangano , a divorced mother of two who designed the miracle mop .

the film also features her silver linings playbook and american hustle co-star bradley cooper in a smaller role as the head of the qvc shopping network , and silver linings star robert de niro as mangano 's father .
read more .
author: The Wrap

documents.title: peter hook takes new order to court
text: as band splits go , the one between bassist peter hook and his former new order bandmates seems to be a deep one .
he is suing the band for millions of pounds in a bitter row over royalties .
'hooky ' left the band - whose hits include blue monday and true faith - in 2007 .
he currently receives 1.25 % of the band 's royalties and other income from merchandising and performances .
but he wants up to 12.5 % .
read more .

documents.title: sunken egyptian treasures on show
text: the british museum is staging its first major exhibition of ancient objects recovered from the seabed .
opening in may 2016 , sunken cities : egypt 's lost worlds will feature 200 artefacts found deep in clay and silt in the mouth of the river nile .
most were excavated from the `` lost '' submerged cities of thonis-heracleion and canopus between 1996 and 2012 .
read more .

documents.title: pink for unicef
text: pop star pink is the latest celebrity to become a unicef ambassador .
`` the fire was lit , obviously , because i 'm a mama , '' the singer , who has a three-year-old daughter , told people magazine .

the grammy-winner will focus on children 's health , namely exercise and nutrition , and will be the spokesperson for the charity 's new initiative , kid power , which aims to inspire healthier lives .
read more .
author: People

documents.title: scotland to `` consciously uncouple '' from uk ?
text: x-men star james mcavoy said that scottish independence is a virtual certainty .
speaking to the sunday times ( pay site ) , mcavoy - who is married to actress anne marie duff - said he thought a split would happen `` in the next decade '' .
`` when we get it , it 'll be - as gwyneth [ paltrow ] once said - a conscious uncoupling , rather than a messy break-up , '' he said .
in september , 53 % of scots residents voted against independence .

documents.title: what if the nazis had won ?
text: the new amazon show the man in the high castle imagines just that .
its advertising on the ny subway has already got the hugely-anticipated show into some trouble .
but , writing for bbc culture , keith uhlich says this type of speculative fiction is nothing new .
read more .

documents.title: howard to direct the girl before
text: oscar-winning director ron howard is to direct the girl before , based on the thriller novel of the same name by jp delaney .
the book itself is n't even published yet - that 's coming next year .
the book is believed to have been written by bestselling author tony strong under a pseudonym
the story involves a traumatised woman who falls in love with a minimalist house and the man who designed it - only to discover that another woman died in the house three years earlier .
dun , dun , duunn
howard directed moby dick film in the heart of the sea , which is released next month .
read more .

documents.title: judith kerr on art and loneliness
text: judith kerr achieved international fame with children 's books the tiger who came to tea and the mog series .
now 92 , she spoke to bbc 6 music about her inspirations and how vital drawing has become in her old age .
`` my husband died some years ago and really the only thing that helps about being alone is that you can work 24 hours a day , if you want to , '' she told mary anne hobbs .
`` if i 'm not drawing i get rather irritable and a bit sad . ''
the interview was part of hobbs ' art is everwhere season , in which listeners were asked to create a piece of art in response to the music , speech and sounds on her weekend breakfast show .
you can see the results on the twitter hashtag # 6musicmakeart .

documents.title: the early days of us shows on british tv
text: today , we all watch american-made shows like the walking dead and modern family and friends ( which seems to be always on at any time of day somewhere in the uk ) .
but it was n't always so .
have a look at this potted history of shows crossing the atlantic .

documents.title: psy says he 'll never repeat gangnam success
text: the official video has been viewed nearly two and a half billion times so it 's not surprising korean singer psy admits : `` i do n't think something like gangnam style will ever happen again . ''
`` the sheer weight of gangnam was so heavy .
i do n't even go to gangnam anymore '' .
he added , referring to the affluent seoul district which gives the song its name .
he has held a press conference to launch his seventh album titled cider .
returning to his west country roots ?

documents.title: stormzy performs in the live lounge
text: one of last year 's bbc sound of finalists was stormzy - who went on to win best grime act at the mobo awards last month .
the 22-year-old just dropped into radio 1 xtra for the culmination of the station 's mc month - his lips a blur as he performed a montage of his singles shut up and standard .

the former track lambasts critics who called him a `` back-up dancer '' when he appeared with kanye west at this year 's brit awards , while standard is a lyrical victory lap , recapping the rapper 's successful year .
author: Mark Savage
Music reporter

documents.title: the woman behind queen anne 's reign
text: the taste for books , plays and programmes about the british monarchy never seems to go away .
yet even now few people know much about queen anne , who reigned for just 12 years .
a new play for the royal shakespeare company aims to change that , delving into the queen 's long and intimate relationship with the aristocrat sarah churchill .
playwright helen edmundson , author of queen anne , admits that - until three years ago - she knew almost nothing about britain 's last stuart monarch .
`` but i 'm sure that 's true of many people who otherwise think they 're pretty clued up about british history .
compared to elizabeth i or victoria she barely registers : it 's true her reign was relatively short but that 's not the whole explanation . ''
in the stratford production , the queen is played by actress emma cunniffe while sarah churchill is played by natascha mcelhone .
read more .

documents.title: radio 4 discusses new music
text: radio 4 listeners got some grime on their crumpets this morning , as the today programme discussed the bbc sound of 2016 longlist .

after playing a selection of the artists tipped for success next year , pundit and dj mistajam explained how he cast his votes : `` it was artists that really mean something - artists that could go on to do very big things .
it is always about the quality of the song . ''
listen to the discussion in the player above .
( ps : is it just my hearing , or does justin webb call his guest `` mistal-jam '' throughout this interview ? )
author: Mark Savage
Music reporter

documents.title: florence added to hyde park festival
text: a year on from her headlining glastonbury performance , florence and the machine have been added to the line-up of next year 's british summer time hyde park .
she joins previously announced headliners take that and mumford & sons at the events which take place next july .
other new artists include us rapper kendrick lamar and jamie xx .
tickets go on sale on friday .

documents.title: len goodman defends strictly over 'fix ' claims
text: and in more strictly news , head judge len goodman has defended the bbc one show following claims in the sun newspaper that the show is fixed .
len said he was saddened by `` chatter '' that the contestants were not fairly judged and said he was standing up for a programme `` that brings joy to so many millions of people '' .

ola jordan , a former professional dancer on the show who has just left strictly after 10 years , appeared to make claims there may have been over-marking by the judges in an interview with the sun earlier this month .
len told the sunday mirror : `` believe me when i say the show is without question fair , honest and without agenda .
my fellow judges and i have been accused of deliberately over and under marking some people - nonsense . ''
peter andre , who left the show last night , also backed len , saying of ola 's claims : i have never heard or seen anything of the sort .
people who have good dances in rehearsals get good marks .
take for example my charleston dance a few weeks ago .
i got two nines and two 10s , but then my jive was not so good . ''
is that the end of the whispers then ?
watch this space .

documents.title: mockingjay holds us top spot
text: the might of sylvester stallone 's most iconic character rocky could not topple jennifer lawrence at the us box office over the weekend .

the final hunger games movie mockingjay : part 2 earned $ 51.6m ( £ 34.3m ) , giving it a second week as champion while pixar 's the good dinosaur and creed , starring stallone and michael b jordan , were left trailing in its wake .
the good dinosaur took $ 39.3m ( £ 26m ) while creed , which sees jordan play the son of retired boxer rocky balboa 's pal apollo creed , made $ 30.1m ( £ 20m ) .
unsurprisingly , while families accounted for 79 % of the pixar movie 's business , creed 's audience was largely male and over the age of 25 , according to exit polls .
read more .

documents.title: celebrity show exits ( spoiler alert ! )
text: it was another brutal weekend in the tv celeb world as several shows saw contestants voted out of their prospective competitions .

one 's strictly come dancing is now on the final stretch , with just six couples left after former favourite peter andre was sent home by the judges following his dance-off with eastenders ' kellie bright .
a wise choice ?
or insania ?
let us know your thoughts !
over on itv , x factor creative director brian friedman became the second i 'm a celebrity contestant to be sent home after a tumultuous day in the jungle .
he told presenters ant and dec he had suspected before the vote was announced that he would be on his way : `` something in me said , pack yourself up and get ready to go home . ''
and over on the x factor itself , filipino girl band 4th impact missed out on a place in next week 's semi-final by becoming the latest act to be eliminated from the show .
the girls thanked the british public who voted for them : `` you guys accepted us and welcomed us into your hearts and that 's unforgettable , thank you so much . ''
awww .

documents.title: music sound of 2016 : reaction
text: the bbc music sound of 2016 aims to predict the brightest and best new talent for the coming year - and , as usual , the list is being pored over for omissions , errors and signs of stardom .

music business worldwide has compiled interesting statistics on how many albums the previous nominees have sold ( while admitting the prize is more about artistic merit than commercial performance ) .

it says that nine of the 75 nominees from the last five years have had platinum albums - about 12 per cent - asserting that the pundits `` do n't get things right quite as much as you might think . ''
gigwise tips 2016 nominees wstrn and ratboy for greatness , but says the winner is too hard to predict .
here are some of the other reactions on social media .
sound of 2016 longlist looking exceptionally good this year .
billie marten has all the talent in the world for someone so young .
but jg or frances could also grab it imo .
would love a rat boy win
loyle carner and wstrn are wicked too .
yeah , it 's a tough one this , is n't it ?

author: Mark Savage
Music reporter

documents.title: catch up on the weekend 's stories
text: if you were out having a life at the weekend , here are some of the big stories you might have missed :
nobel prize winner malala yousafzai has said she is `` proud to be called a brummie '' at the unveiling of a portrait in her adopted city .
but what we really want to know is , how is her accent coming along ?
in film news , selma director ava duvernay has welcomed an apology by film-makers accused of `` whitewashing '' forthcoming adventure movie gods of egypt .
last week both the film 's director , alex proyas , and studio , lionsgate , apologised for the offence .
the action movie - due to be released early next year - sees white actors such as gerard butler , rufus sewell and geoffrey rush take centre stage in a film about warring egyptian gods .
and it would n't be the live page without a bit of daily adele news - her latest album 25 has sold a record-breaking 3.38 million copies in its first week on sale in the us .
the british star notched up the largest single sales week for an album since sales began to be monitored in 1991 .
25 - released on 20 november - has also become the first album to sell more than three million copies in a week .

documents.title: get involved
text: do you have any thoughts on the sound of 2016 longlist ?
are there any artists that you feel have been missed ?
please get in touch and let us know or talk to us about any of our other stories by emailing us at entertainment.news @ bbc.co.uk or tweeting @ bbcnewsents .
author: Kev Geoghegan
Arts and entertainment reporter

documents.title: will the sound of 2016 find the next adele ?
text: music 's `` sound of '' list has predicted the success of people like sam smith , adele and ellie goulding - so you could easily find music 's next biggest star amongst the 15 nominees on this year 's list .
some of the names might be familiar - jack garratt won the brits critics ' choice award last week , while grime collective section boyz were named best newcomer at this year 's mobo awards .
others , like nao or mura masa are less well-known .
you can listen to a compilation of all 15 acts via bbc playlister ; or let huw stephens and annie mac guide you through the longlist below .
author: Mark Savage
Music reporter

documents.title: good morning
text: hello all , welcome back to the arts and entertainment live page .
we 'll be bringing you all the news from the weekend that you might have missed , as well as all the latest as it comes in .
if you did n't catch it last week , here is friday 's round-up with coldplay monkeying around in their latest music video .
coming up , we 'll have reaction to the bbc 's sound of 2016 longlist .
author: Emma Saunders
Entertainment reporter
